channel.title: Why give credits
channel.description:
Ok, i see people releasing there client/source things. And then there always a smart ass who says.
"Oh, I think deltascape deserves more credit"
Well honestly, all the credit should really go to Jagex retard....
Next time you think of comment on someones "Credits"
Remember who really gave birth to this game...
-Will

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:9, topic:350126”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=446492.msg3277170#msg3277170 date=1279607800]
Jagex does not deserve credits for anything server sided. The client is theres and the server is ours. The only thing you can possibly give credits for server side is the Stream class because it was ripped directly out of the client.[/quote]
Without the Stream class, winterLove wasn’t possible.[/quote]

Nope, it’s still possible to write your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:14, topic:350126”]Thanking someone for helping you in a thread is normal. If they helped you develop the server, you’re not going to completely dismiss it and say “nonono Jagex done it all, dey maek duh good game for me to emoolate”. And at the same time, you can’t list specific amounts of credit because there’s honestly no way to calculate such commission.[/quote]except if like you divide all the lines of code by 100 and for every blah and blah lines they make, add, edit w/e you give them 1%. Even then it will be unaccurate.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Thanking someone for helping you in a thread is normal. If they helped you develop the server, you’re not going to completely dismiss it and say “nonono Jagex done it all, dey maek duh good game for me to emoolate”. And at the same time, you can’t list specific amounts of credit because there’s honestly no way to calculate such commission.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

People rip stuff from Jagex, that doesn’t mean he gives it to us, and doesn’t mean when we rip stuff give him credits…

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

… “It’s not that hard, and all Jagex did was made a class that writes to and reads from an array.” Most of the stream class has nothing to do with the RuneScape protocol… The only things are creating packets and reading/writing strings and maybe a few other things I forgot about.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

late 2005/early 2006: kaitnieks was an active and thriving cheating community for runescape same era: wL made his first server in order to test bots and learn about the protocol. it was single player and horribly coded early 2006: daiki takes wL's source and makes it multiplayer, still a "proof of concept" with maybe a bit of support/interest for actually playing it, releases it under the name "blakescape d boosted" same era: kaitnieks shuts down soon after: mitb forms for the refugees of the death of kaitnieks, runescape cheating becomes centralized once more soon after that: development continues by random individuals on the opensource blakescape server and interest increases in hosting/playing servers soon after that (mid-2006): mitb separates itself from private servers by creating mscp late 2006: google comes out 2007: mscp is booming with thousands of people 2007+: mscp/mitb are slowly dying (still) as cheating and emulation become decentralized, while content development is made by hundreds of amateur programmers
Referring from that quote, he was still learning about the protocol, no?

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:9, topic:350126”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=446492.msg3277170#msg3277170 date=1279607800]
Jagex does not deserve credits for anything server sided. The client is theres and the server is ours. The only thing you can possibly give credits for server side is the Stream class because it was ripped directly out of the client.[/quote]
Without the Stream class, winterLove wasn’t possible.[/quote]Very, VERY wrong. Seeing that winterLove actually knew what he was doing, he probably could have created his owned Stream class. It’s not that hard, and all Jagex did was made a class that writes to and reads from an array.

And no point in giving Jagex credits. First off, other than the Stream and Cryption classes, they did nothing server-sided. Second, everybody already knows Jagex made the client and it’s just something that serves no purpose to be pointed out.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Aeolian:

Jagex does not deserve credits for anything server sided. The client is theres and the server is ours. The only thing you can possibly give credits for server side is the Stream class because it was ripped directly out of the client.

Without the Stream class, winterLove wasn’t possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote=“aquikzebra, post:1, topic:350126”]Ok, i see people releasing there client/source things. And then there always a smart ass who says.

“Oh, I think deltascape deserves more credit”

Well honestly, all the credit should really go to Jagex retard…

Next time you think of comment on someones “Credits”

Remember who really gave birth to this game…

-Will[/quote]

Jagex does not deserve credits for anything server sided. The client is theres and the server is ours. The only thing you can possibly give credits for server side is the Stream class because it was ripped directly out of the client.

As for the credits issue. Credits should only be issued to people who have made a major impact on the source you’re using. Know your source and know its history or you might be flamed.

Also, please refrain from posting percentages in your credits. All those statistics are inaccurate, simply add their names and possibly a small comment.

[quote=“Kihomura, post:6, topic:350126”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=446492.msg3276956#msg3276956 date=1279589357]
thanks to bob, joe, and most of all, tom?
[/quote]
That should be fine, but having credits such as

Kihomura - 85%
The Reaper X - 5%
Jayden - 10%

is against the rules.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,312149.0.html[/quote]

^This.

Read full topic

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @aquikzebra aquikzebra
item.description:
@aquikzebra wrote:

I understand you, personally I think credits are annoying.

Because there is always an argument on who deserves more…

-Will

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @aquikzebra aquikzebra

But honestly, if there wasnt a “runescape”

There would never be RSPS…

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Kihomura:

Giving credits saying one person deserves more than the other is against the rules. There’s no way to calculate this, so you’re just supposed to list names only.

Can we say…

thanks to bob, joe, and most of all, tom?

item.title: Why give credits
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

No it shouldn’t really Jagex developed the game engine, the person who programmed the server with java should deserve the credits. Well that’s my personal opinion.
